definition: to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
variant of 草[cao3]
grass/straw/manuscript/draft (of a document)/careless/rough/CL:棵[ke1],撮[zuo3],株[zhu1],根[gen1]
variant of 肏[cao4]
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: Let us use it to end AIDS – once and for all.
sentences.chinese: 让我们借此势头，去消灭艾滋病，将它斩草除根。

sentences.english: We can never leave evil unchecked, we must remove the source of the trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不可养痈遗患，一定要斩草除根。

sentences.english: They truly believed that to remain was to risk extermination.
sentences.chinese: 他们确实相信留下来需冒着斩草除根的风险。

sentences.english: Love is like a shovel to the pain.
sentences.chinese: 爱心犹如一把铲能把痛苦斩草除根。

strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
remaining evil element/surviving members (of evil former regime)/dregs (of colonial administration)
lit. to nurture a tiger invites calamity/fig. to indulge one's enemy is asking for trouble (idiom)
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
